cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 975 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina and 410 mi S of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest to northwest across the southwestern Atlantic, aiming toward the North Carolina/South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear, North Carolina (NC/SC border area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, South Carolina to the North Carolina–Virginia border, including the Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coast from South Carolina through Virginia; elevated surf and rip-current risk along the entire East Coast, including Florida
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of tropical-storm-force winds; otherwise breezy northeasterly flow
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Jacksonville’s coast based on current track
weather_observation.rainfall: Occasional outer rainbands possible; rainfall generally light and not expected to exceed flooding thresholds
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf along northeast Florida beaches
